required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study Evaluating the Efficacy and Safety of Obeticholic Acid in Subjects With Compensated Cirrhosis Due to Nonalcoholic Steatohepatitis
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 3, Double-Blind, Randomized, Placebo-Controlled, Multicenter Study to Evaluate the Efficacy and Safety of Obeticholic Acid in Subjects With Compensated Cirrhosis Due to Nonalcoholic Steatohepatitis

brief_summary.textblock: The primary objective of this study is to evaluate whether obeticholic acid (OCA; INT-747) can lead to histological improvement in fibrosis with no worsening of NASH in adults with compensated cirrhosis due to NASH.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of subjects with improvement in fibrosis by at least 1 stage with no worsening of NASH, using NASH Clinical Research Network (CRN) scoring system

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of subjects with improvement in fibrosis by at least 2 stages, using Ishak scoring criteria
Percentage of subjects with NASH resolution, using the NASH CRN scoring

arm_group.description: 10 mg OCA for up to 18 months
10 mg OCA for the first 3 months and then may titrate up to 25 mg OCA for the remaining 15 months of the study

criteria.textblock:
Key inclusion criteria:
1. Subjects with a confirmed diagnosis of NASH and a fibrosis score of 4 based upon the NASH CRN scoring system determined by central reading
Key exclusion criteria:
1. Current or past history of a clinically evident hepatic decompensation event, such as ascites, hepatic encephalopathy (HE), or variceal bleeding
2. Current or past history of CP score ≥7 points
3. Model for End-stage Liver Disease (MELD) score > 12
4. ALT ≥ 5 X ULN
5. Calculated creatinine clearance <60mL/min using Cockcroft-Gault method
6. Hemoglobin A1c (HbA1c) ≥ 9.5 %
7. Evidence of other known forms of chronic liver disease such as alcoholic liver disease, hepatitis B, hepatitis C, PBC, PSC, autoimmune hepatitis, Wilson disease, iron overload, alpha-1-antitrypsin deficiency, drug-induced liver injury, known or suspected hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC)
8. History of liver transplant, or current placement on a liver transplant list
